meanings.definition: To polish or shine (a surface) with wax.
meanings.sent1: I will simonize my car to make it sparkle in the sun.
meanings.sent2: She simonized the wooden table to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: After I simonize the floor, it looks like a mirror reflecting everything.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to simonize the coin, making it gleam like gold.
meanings.sent5: The car wash offers a special service to simonize your vehicle for a brilliant shine.

meanings.definition: To make something shiny or glossy.
meanings.sent1: He used a special cloth to simonize the glass windows until they sparkled.
meanings.sent2: The furniture store simonizes all their products to attract customers with the shine.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret to success was to simonize the plates, making the food look even more appetizing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to simonize her face, radiating happiness and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler would simonize the gems, making them glisten like stars in the night sky.
